title: 111_s4001
content: The Act is titled the "Marine Corps Aviation Centennial Commemorative Coin Act." Congress recognizes the 100th Anniversary of Marine Corps Aviation in 2012 and highlights its essential qualities like adaptability and agility. Marine Corps Aviation is crucial to the success of the Marine Corps Air Ground Task Force and the nation's expeditionary "Force in Readiness." The Marine Corps Heritage Center, opened in 2006, aims to provide historical displays, artifact storage, research facilities, and offices. A commemorative $10 gold coin is proposed to honor Marine Corps Aviation Centennial and raise funds for the center's construction. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue up to 100,000 $10 gold coins, each weighing 8.359 grams, with a diameter of 0.850 inches, and containing 90% gold and 10% alloy. These coins will be legal tender. The design of coins minted under this Act will symbolize the warrior ethos of the United States Marine Corps, with specific inscriptions and designations. The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with relevant entities and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities from a single U.S. Mint facility during a one-year period starting on January 1, 2013. The Secretary will sell coins at a price including face value, a $35 surcharge, and design/issuance costs. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. The Secretary will promptly pay all surcharges received from coin sales to the Marine Corps Heritage Foundation for the construction of the Marine Corps Heritage Center. The Foundation will be audited for the amounts received.
